column2: Genetic variation near IRS1 associates with reduced adiposity and an impaired metabolic profile.
column4: Kilpelainen TO and Zillikens MC and Stancakova A and Finucane FM and Ried JS and Langenberg C and Zhang W and Beckmann JS and Luan J and Vandenput L and Styrkarsdottir U and Zhou Y and Smith AV and Zhao JH and Amin N and Vedantam S and Shin SY and Haritunians T and Fu M and Feitosa MF and Kumari M and Halldorsson BV and Tikkanen E and Mangino M and Hayward C and Song C and Arnold AM and Aulchenko YS and Oostra BA and Campbell H and Cupples LA and Davis KE and Doring A and Eiriksdottir G and Estrada K and Fernandez-Real JM and Garcia M and Gieger C and Glazer NL and Guiducci C and Hofman A and Humphries SE and Isomaa B and Jacobs LC and Jula A and Karasik D and Karlsson MK and Khaw KT and Kim LJ and Kivimaki M and Klopp N and Kuhnel B and Kuusisto J and Liu Y and Ljunggren O and Lorentzon M and Luben RN and McKnight B and Mellstrom D and Mitchell BD and Mooser V and Moreno JM and Mannisto S and O'Connell JR and Pascoe L and Peltonen L and Peral B and Perola M and Psaty BM and Salomaa V and Savage DB and Semple RK and Skaric-Juric T and Sigurdsson G and Song KS and Spector TD and Syvanen AC and Talmud PJ and Thorleifsson G and Thorsteinsdottir U and Uitterlinden AG and van Duijn CM and Vidal-Puig A and Wild SH and Wright AF and Clegg DJ and Schadt E and Wilson JF and Rudan I and Ripatti S and Borecki IB and Shuldiner AR and Ingelsson E and Jansson JO and Kaplan RC and Gudnason V and Harris TB and Groop L and Kiel DP and Rivadeneira F and Walker M and Barroso I and Vollenweider P and Waeber G and Chambers JC and Kooner JS and Soranzo N and Hirschhorn JN and Stefansson K and Wichmann HE and Ohlsson C and O'Rahilly S and Wareham NJ and Speliotes EK and Fox CS and Laakso M and Loos RJ
column6: Genome-wide association studies have identified 32 loci influencing body mass index, but this measure does not distinguish lean from fat mass. To identify adiposity loci, we meta-analyzed associations between approximately 2.5 million SNPs and body fat percentage from 36,626 individuals and followed up the 14 most significant (P < 10(-6)) independent loci in 39,576 individuals. We confirmed a previously established adiposity locus in FTO (P = 3 x 10(-26)) and identified two new loci associated with body fat percentage, one near IRS1 (P = 4 x 10(-11)) and one near SPRY2 (P = 3 x 10(-8)). Both loci contain genes with potential links to adipocyte physiology. Notably, the body-fat-decreasing allele near IRS1 is associated with decreased IRS1 expression and with an impaired metabolic profile, including an increased visceral to subcutaneous fat ratio, insulin resistance, dyslipidemia, risk of diabetes and coronary artery disease and decreased adiponectin levels. Our findings provide new insights into adiposity and insulin resistance.
